intro: Dupatya polygona, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires a humid, temperate climate. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
